metadata.title: CVE-2011-3372 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
imap/nntpd.c in the NNTP server (nntpd) for Cyrus IMAPd 2.4.x before 2.4.12allows remote attackers to bypass authentication by sending an AUTHINFOUSER command without sending an additional AUTHINFO PASS command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3372` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cyrus-admin - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-admin-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-caldav - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-caldav-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-clients - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-clients-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-common - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-common-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-imapd - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-imapd-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-murder - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-murder-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-nntpd - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-nntpd-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-pop3d - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-pop3d-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-replication - 2.4.16-1
cyrus-replication-2.4 - 2.4.16-1
libcyrus-imap-perl - 2.4.16-1
libcyrus-imap-perl24 - 2.4.16-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: cyrus-imapd-2.4 package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.16-1').
